Crimes.Crime_Name: Marriage Fraud under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Officer err in concluding that the marriage was not genuine and entered into primarily for immigration purposes?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of immigration officer’s decision on permanent residency application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer found discrepancies in interviews and insufficient evidence of intimacy
Evidence_Type: Timing of marriage after visa overstay
Lack of evidence of shared life or intimacy
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was not genuine and entered primarily for immigration benefits
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Timing of marriage following visa overstay and report by authorities
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: s. 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Dismissed – no error found in officer’s assessment
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether decision falls within range of acceptable outcomes
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not primarily for acquiring status under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Factor: Applicant married shortly after overstaying visa and being reported
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Permanent residency application refused due to suspected marriage fraud
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of officer’s conclusion on marriage genuineness
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: s. 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Suspicious timing, lack of proof of genuine relationship, interview inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence provided by applicant to prove genuine marital relationship
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed standard judicial review procedures
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review challenging reasonableness of decision
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process assessing administrative decision-making
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation related to marriage for immigration purposes

Crimes.Violation_Type: Unlawful presence in Canada after expiration of authorized stay
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the immigration officer err in concluding that the marriage was not genuine and entered into primarily for acquiring permanent residence status?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa, worked illegally, married shortly after being reported
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Permanent residency application denied; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized period, engaged in unauthorized work
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation of unreasonable refusal of permanent residency based on marriage
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Conjunctive test: marriage must be genuine and not primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Temporal proximity between overstay, report, and marriage
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative immigration decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer questioned authenticity of relationship due to suspicious circumstances
Crimes.Application_Basis: Application for permanent residency based on spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Timing, conduct, and credibility of relationship claims
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Certification of general importance and intervention by court
Crimes.Governing_Rule: s. 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate genuine relationship independent of immigration benefit
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Unauthorized stay and work affecting immigration integrity
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa, worked illegally, and entered marriage under suspicious circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered all available evidence including interview notes and documentation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 4 – requirement for genuine marriage
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Inconsistent statements and lack of corroborative evidence
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Potential misrepresentation through use of marriage to gain status
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Holistic evaluation of behavioral and documentary evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Marriage occurred under suspicious conditions post-overstay
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of sufficient proof of bona fide relationship
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness of administrative decision under Canadian administrative law

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refusal of permanent residency based on alleged sham marriage
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Officer err in concluding that the marriage was not genuine or entered into primarily for immigration purposes?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal of refusal of permanent residency application based on spousal relationship
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer identified inconsistencies in relationship narrative
Evidence_Type: Lack of shared financial or domestic life evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage used as vehicle to obtain immigration status despite illegality
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Whether officer’s conclusion was reasonable based on evidence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Marriage shortly before being reported while out of status
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine and not primarily for immigration advantage
Crimes.Application_Factor: Applicant had expired work permit, unauthorized employment, and questionable marriage timing
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of permanent residency based on suspicion of marriage fraud
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether officer made an error in assessing marriage genuineness
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Suspected fraudulent marriage to circumvent immigration rules after work permit expiry
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictory information provided about relationship history and dynamics
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Standard procedural safeguards observed in decision-making
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on truthfulness of relationship claims due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review seeking to overturn refusal decision
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lawfulness and reasonableness of refusal decision in spousal sponsorship context
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation concerning marital relationship for immigration purposes
